intro: Chrysophyllum brenesii, commonly known as the Guanacaste tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces a fruit that is typically a capsule containing several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
